Key Arguments: The draft Bill restricts freedom of speech by imposing legal requirements for accuracy and harmlessness on ordinary people but not on governments and news media.

The Bill may be exploited by activists to silence opponents by accusing them of misinformation or disinformation.
The legislation could negatively impact discussions on international conflicts by potentially censoring diverse viewpoints.
The exemption of government statements from being labeled as misinformation or disinformation creates a double standard.
